info.name: API documentation_1
info.description:
# ðŸ“„ Get started with NTUAflix API

NTUAflix API is a comprehensive solution for managing movie-related data and user interactions. It provides a robust set of functionalities for both administrators and regular users. This guide will walk you through the steps required to start using the NTUAflix API efficiently.

## Overview

NTUAflix API offers functionalities for managing users, movies, and user interactions. Administrators can upload data, manage users, and perform administrative tasks, while regular users can browse movies, manage their profiles, and interact with the platform.

## Getting Started Guide

  
To start using NTUAflix API, follow these steps:

1. Initializing Database:
    

Start a MySQL Server (e.g., using XAMPP).  
Create the database using the provided schema file (./utils/ntuaflix_create_schema.sql).  
Optionally, you can populate the database with sample data from TSV files using the command npm run data.

2\. Start the Server and REST-API:

Install all dependencies with npm install.  
Run the REST-API with npm start.

  
3\. Authentication:

Use provided credentials to authenticate:  
Admin Credentials: { "username": "admin", "password": "1234" }  
User Credentials: { "username": "user", "password": "1234" }

  
4\. Testing:

Ensure the local web development toolkit is running.  
Install dependencies with npm install.  
Run tests with npm test.

##   
Authentication

  
NTUAflix API uses JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for authentication. Users can obtain tokens by logging in with their credentials. The token must be included in the request header for subsequent authenticated requests.

Rate and Usage Limits  
NTUAflix API imposes rate limits to ensure fair usage and prevent abuse. Requests exceeding the limit will receive an HTTP 429 Too Many Requests status code.

### Need Some Help?

  
If you need assistance or have questions regarding NTUAflix API, consider the following resources:

Readme files: There are readme files in "backend","frontend" and "cli-client" folders that contain all the necessary information to properly run the app.  
FAQ Page: Contact team 33  
We're committed to providing comprehensive support to ensure you have a smooth experience with NTUAflix API.

request.description:
This endpoint sends an HTTP GET request to [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/healthcheck](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/healthcheck) to retrieve the health status of the server. The response will be in JSON format with a status code of 200. The response body will contain the status and details about the host, port, user, and database.

Responses:

- 200 {"status": "OK"}
    
- 401 Unauthorized
    
- 500 Error establishing database connection

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves user details for the admin panel using as a parameter the username of the user. It makes an HTTP GET request to the specified URL. The response will have a status code of 200 and a content type of application/json. The response body will contain the user details including user_id, username, email, first_name, last_name, birthdate, and role.

Responses :

- 200 User info retrieved successfully.
    
- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 404 User not found.
    
- 500 Error establishing database connection.

request.description:
This API endpoint allows administrators to upload title basics to the NTUAFlix database. The HTTP POST request should be made to [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/upload/titlebasics](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/upload/titlebasics). The request body should be of form-data type and include a file parameter, which should be a file containing the title basics data.

Upon a successful execution, the API returns a 201 status code with a JSON response body containing a message indicating the success of the upload.

Responses:

- 201 File uploaded and proccessed successfully.
    
- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal server error.

This endpoint allows administrators to upload name basics to the NTUAFlix API. The HTTP POST request should be made to [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/upload/namebasics](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/upload/namebasics).

### Request Body

The request should have a form-data body type with a parameter named "file" of type file. This parameter is used to upload the name basics data.

Responses:

- 201 File uploaded and proccessed successfully.
    
- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal server error.

pm.test("Message is a non-empty string", function () {
pm.test("Message field contains the expected value", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint allows administrators to upload title crew information. The request should be sent as an HTTP POST to [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/upload/titlecrew](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/upload/titlecrew).

### Request Body

The request should have a form-data body type with a single parameter:

- `file` (file): The file containing the title crew information to be uploaded.
    

Responses:

- 201 File uploaded and proccessed successfully.
    
- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal server error.

This endpoint is used to reset all data for the admin in the NTUAFlix API. Upon successful execution, it returns a status code of 201 and a JSON response with a "status" key.

### Request Body

This endpoint does not require a request body.

Responses:

- 201 Data reset successfully.
    
- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal server error.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to update the username and password for a user in the admin panel of NTUAFlix. Upon a successful request, it returns a JSON response with a status code of 200 and a message indicating the success of the operation.

The request should be a POST method to the URL [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/usermod/newusername/updatedpasword](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/admin/usermod/newusername/updatedpasword).

The response will have a Content-Type of application/json and will contain a message field in the JSON body.

### Example Response 200

``` json
{
    "message": "Registration Completed. Please login"
}

 ```

Example Response

``` json
    "message": "Password Updated"
}

 ```

Other responses:

- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal server error.

request.description:
This endpoint allows users to log in and obtain an authentication token. The HTTP POST request should be made to [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/auth/login](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/auth/login) with the raw request body type. The request should include the "username" and "password" fields.

### Request Body

- `username` (string): The username of the user.
- `password` (string): The password of the user.
    

### Response 200:

Upon successful execution, the response will have a status code of 200 and a content type of application/json. The response will include the following fields:

- `success` (boolean): Indicates whether the login was successful.
- `message` (string): Any additional message related to the login.
- `token` (string): The authentication token obtained upon successful login.
    

Other responses:

- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal server error.

item.description: This routes are responsible for authenticating the user , that includes the registration of a user (insertion into the database) , the login of the user (creation of the token) and logging out of the user (invalidation of the current token).

item.name: User's routes

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to create a user profile. The HTTP PUT request should be sent to [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/user/createProfile](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/user/createProfile).

### Request Body

The request body should be in raw JSON format and include the following parameters:

- `firstname` (string): The user's first name.
- `lastname` (string): The user's last name.
- `birthDate` (string): The user's date of birth.
- `email` (string): The user's email address.
- `favorite_genre` (string): The user's favorite genre.
    

Responses :

- 200 Profile updated successfully.
    
- 400 Bad request.
    
- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal server error.

exec: pm.test("Response has the required fields", function () {
pm.test("Email is in a valid format", function () {
pm.test("BirthDate is in a valid date format", function () {
pm.test("Username is a non-empty string", function () {

This endpoint retrieves the user's profile information from the NTUAFlix API.

The response will be in JSON format with the following fields:

- firstname (string): The user's first name.
- lastname (string): The user's last name.
- birthDate (string): The user's date of birth.
- email (string): The user's email address.
- username (string): The user's username.
    

Responses:

- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal Server Error.

request.description:
This endpoint allows users to update their profile information via an HTTP PUT request. The request should be sent to [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/user/updateProfile](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/user/updateProfile).

### Request Body

The request body should be in raw format and include the following parameters:

- `username` (string): The new username for the user.
- `password` (string): The new password for the user.
    

Responses:

- 201 SUser profile updated successfully.
    
- 400 Username already in use by another user.
    
- 500 Internal Server Error.

request.description:
This endpoint retrieves the watchlist for the user. It returns a JSON array containing details of the titles in the watchlist, including title ID, type, original title, poster, start and end year, genres, alternative titles, principals, and ratings.

The response will have a status code of 200, indicating a successful retrieval of the watchlist. The content type of the response is 'application/json'.

Responses:

- 200 Successful retireval of watchlist.
    
- 204 No movies in the watchlist.
    
- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal Server Error.

request.description:
This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to delete a movie with the specified ID from the user's watchlist in the NTUAFlix API.

The response to the request returns a status code of 204, indicating a successful deletion, and the Content-Type is set to text/xml.

No specific data is included in the response body.

Responses:

- 204 Title deleted from wathclist.
    
- 404 Title not found or not in wathclist.
    
- 500 Internal Server Error.

request.description:
This endpoint sends an HTTP DELETE request to delete a movie with the specified ID from the user's favorites list in the NTUAFlix API.

The response to the request returns a status code of 204, indicating a successful deletion, and the Content-Type is set to text/xml.

No specific data is included in the response body.

Responses:

- 204 Title deleted from favorites list.
    
- 404 Title not found or not in favorites list.
    
- 500 Internal Server Error.

This HTTP GET request retrieves information about a specific title with the given ID "tt0068494" from the NTUAFlix API. The response will be in JSON format and will include details such as title ID, type, original title, poster, start and end year, genres, alternate titles, principals, and ratings.

The response will include the following fields:

- titleID: The ID of the title
- type: The type of the title
- originalTitle: The original title of the title
- titlePoster: The poster of the title
- startYear: The start year of the title
- endYear: The end year of the title
- genres: An array containing alternate titles and region abbreviations
- akasInfo: An array containing genre titles
- principals: An array containing name IDs, names, and categories
- rating: An array containing average rating and number of votes
    

Please note that the actual values for these fields will be returned in the response.

Responses :

- 200 Itle information retrieved successfully.
    
- 400 Bad request.
    
- 401 Unauthorized.

response.name: New Request

request.description:
# Search Title

This endpoint allows you to search for titles based on the provided title part.

## Request

### Request URL

- Method: GET
- URL: `https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/searchtitle`
    

### Request Body

- Type: Raw
- Payload:
    
    ``` json
      {
        "titlePart": ""
      }
    
     ```
    

## Response

- Status: 200
- Content-Type: application/json
    

### Response Body

The response will be a JSON array containing objects with the following properties:

- `titleID` (string): The ID of the title
- `type` (string): The type of the title
- `originalTitle` (string): The original title
- `titlePoster` (string): The poster of the title
- `startYear` (number): The start year of the title
- `endYear` (number): The end year of the title
- `genres` (array): An array of objects containing `akaTitle` and `regionAbbrev` properties
- `akasInfo` (array): An array of objects containing `genreTitle` property
- `principals` (array): An array of objects containing `nameID`, `name`, and `category` properties
- `rating` (array): An array of rating information
    

Other responses :

- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 404 Not found.
    
- 500 Internal Server Errror.

response.name: New Request

exec: pm.test("Genres array is present and contains the expected number of elements", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve content by genre from the NTUAFlix API. The request should be sent to [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/bygenre](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/bygenre).

### Request Parameters

- `qgenre` (string, optional): Specifies the genre for which content needs to be retrieved.
- `minrating` (string, optional): Specifies the minimum rating for the content to be retrieved.
    

### Response status 200:

Upon a successful request, the server responds with a status code of 200 and a JSON array containing content details. Each object in the array includes the following fields:

- `titleID` (string): Unique identifier for the title.
- `type` (string): Type of content.
- `originalTitle` (string): Original title of the content.
- `titlePoster` (string): URL of the poster for the content.
- `startYear` (integer): Start year of the content.
- `endYear` (integer): End year of the content.
- `genres` (array): Array of objects containing additional genre information.
- `akasInfo` (array): Array of objects containing additional title information.
- `principals` (array): Array of objects containing principal information.
- `rating` (array): Array of objects containing rating information, including average rating and number of votes.
    

Please note that the response may contain multiple objects, each representing a different piece of content.

Other responses:

- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 404 Not found.
    
- 500 Internal Server Error.

response.name: search title by genre

request.description:
This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve information about a specific name from the NTUAFlix API. The request should be made to [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/name/nm0000019](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/name/nm0000019).

### Response status 200:

Upon a successful request, the server will respond with a status code of 200 and a JSON object containing details about the requested name. The response will include the name's ID, name, poster, birth year, death year, profession, and a list of titles associated with the name.

Other responses:

- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 404 Contributor not found.
    
- 500 Internal Server Error.

exec: pm.test("Name is a non-empty string", function () {
pm.test("Birth year and death year are non-negative integers", function () {
pm.test("Name titles array is present and has expected number of elements", function () {

request.description:
# Search Name API

This API endpoint allows you to search for names in the NTUAFlix database.

## Request

### Endpoint

`GET` [https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/searchname](https://localhost:9876/ntuaflix_api/searchname)

### Query Parameters

- `namePart` (string, required): The partial name to search for.
    

## Response

### Status

The API returns a `200` status code on success.

### Content Type

`application/json`

### Response Body status 200:

The response body is an array of objects, where each object represents a name in the database. Each object contains the following properties:

- `nameID` (string): The ID of the name.
- `name` (string): The name of the person.
- `namePoster` (string): The poster of the person.
- `birthYr` (number): The birth year of the person.
- `deathYr` (number): The death year of the person.
- `profession` (string): The profession of the person.
- `nameTitles` (array): An array of objects representing the titles associated with the person, where each object contains the following properties:
    - `titleID` (string): The ID of the title.
    - `category` (string): The category of the title.

Other responses:

- 404 No data found.
    
- 401 Unauthorized.
    
- 500 Internal Server error.

item.description:
```
User Usecase 1:
  - Browse on titles by titlepart.
  - Browse on titles by genre.
  - Get info of a specific title.
  - Browse on contributor name by namepart.
  - Get info of a specific contributor.
User Usecase 2:
  - Create user profile.
  - Add movies to your "Favorites" list.
  - Add movied to your "Watchlater" list.
  - Edit these lists.
  - Update user profile info.
  - View the contents of your lists.

 ```
